title: Set up GitHub remote and sync
description: Configure git remote on GitHub using 'gh' CLI and API key. Ensure repository is pushed and 'bd sync' is configured.

title: Implement MapsHydrator
description: Implement the BaseHydrator for Google Maps enrichment. Refactor from integrations/maps/google_maps.py to hydrators/maps.py.

title: Silent error handling in LocalFileProvider.get_venues() hides failures
description: In file_provider.py:54-56, JSON decode errors and validation errors are caught with 'continue', silently skipping invalid venue files. Per AGENTS.md philosophy 'Fail-Fast', this should raise explicit errors or at minimum log a warning. Current behavior masks data problems.

title: Extract utils/fingerprint.py with TDD tests
close_reason: Completed fingerprint utility extraction with TDD: 8 tests, 100% coverage, committed in b6eb60a

title: Define SPE Core Abstractions (BaseProvider, BaseHydrator, BaseEmitter)
description: Implement the base interfaces for the Source-Pipeline-Emitter model in itingen.core.base. This includes the abstract definitions for Providers, Hydrators, and Emitters.

title: Implement AI Hydrators and Caching
description: Implement BaseHydrator for AI Narratives and Image Generation, including the asset caching mechanism in hydrators/ai/.

title: Venue model requires metadata but VenueMetadata has no defaults
description: Venue.metadata is a required field (no default), and VenueMetadata requires created_at and updated_at (no defaults). This makes programmatic venue creation verbose. Consider auto-generating timestamps or making metadata optional.

title: Domain models use extra='allow' which may hide typos in field names
description: Event and Venue models in core/domain/ use ConfigDict(extra='allow') for extensibility. While intentional for Markdown flexibility, this means typos like 'locaton' instead of 'location' are silently accepted. Consider adding validation layer or strict mode option.

title: Missing integration tests for LocalFileProvider with malformed Markdown
description: The file_provider.py markdown parser handles edge cases but lacks tests for: malformed event blocks, missing headers, events with no fields, duplicate event headings, deeply nested structures. Current tests only cover happy path.

title: Transition Events and Venues to Domain Models
description: Refactor existing event and venue structures into pure domain models (Pydantic/Dataclasses) within itingen.core.domain.

title: Phase 1.2: Explore Source Files from scaffold project
close_reason: Completed thorough exploration of NZ trip source code

title: Document core data structures (Event, Venue schemas)
description: Create docs/DATA_STRUCTURES.md with Event and Venue schema documentation

title: Phase 1.1: Review Technical Decisions from scaffold project
close_reason: Completed comprehensive review of all 18 technical decision documents

title: Implement Core Pipeline Orchestrator
description: Develop the central orchestrator that manages the flow from Provider through a sequence of Hydrators to Emitters.

title: Add AIDEV-NOTE comments to complex modules lacking them
description: Per project standards, all complex logic should have AIDEV-NOTE comments. Currently missing from: providers/file_provider.py (markdown parsing), utils/slug.py (tokenization algorithm), utils/json_repair.py (regex pattern). These would help future AI agents understand the code.

title: Implement WeatherHydrator
description: Implement the BaseHydrator for WeatherSpark enrichment. Refactor from integrations/weather/weatherspark.py to hydrators/weather.py.

title: Consider adding pydantic to explicit dependencies
description: The domain models use Pydantic BaseModel but pydantic is not listed in pyproject.toml dependencies. It may be a transitive dependency of google-genai, but explicit declaration would prevent breakage if that changes.

title: Phase 1.4: Identify Test Cases
close_reason: Created comprehensive test plan with 200+ test cases across unit, integration, E2E, and validation tests

title: json_repair.py may produce invalid JSON with nested structures
description: The extract_json() function finds first '[' or '{' and last ']' or '}'. For text like 'result: [1,2] and {a:1}', it returns '[1,2] and {a:1}' which is invalid JSON. The test on line 98-109 acknowledges this limitation but it should either be fixed or clearly documented as a known limitation.

title: EXTRACTION_PLAN.md phase status is out of sync with actual progress
description: EXTRACTION_PLAN.md shows Phase 2.1 partially complete but Phase 2.2 and 2.3 items are also implemented (domain models, base abstractions, orchestrator, file provider). The plan status should be updated to reflect current progress.

title: Fix unused imports and variables flagged by ruff linter
description: Ruff identified unused imports in tests: tempfile, Any, Dict, Optional in test_exif.py, and unused variable 'result' in test_pipeline_orchestrator.py. Run 'ruff check src/ tests/' to see full list.

title: BaseEmitter.emit returns bool but orchestrator only uses it for failure detection
description: The orchestrator collects emitter output paths in 'results' list (line 103) but appends the path string rather than using the bool return. The return value semantics are unclear - should emit() return the output path, a success bool, or both? Consider returning Optional[str] (path or None on failure).

title: Test misclassification: write tests placed in TestReadExifMetadata class
description: In test_exif.py, test_write_exif_exception_handling() and test_write_exif_no_exif_object() are placed inside TestReadExifMetadata class (lines 146-170) but they test write functionality. They should be in TestWriteExifMetadata class for proper organization.

title: Add missing type hints to BaseProvider/BaseHydrator/BaseEmitter abstract methods
description: The abstract base classes in core/base.py have pass statements in abstract methods. While functional, adding explicit NotImplementedError would be clearer. Also get_venues returns Dict[str, Any] but should return Dict[str, Venue] for type safety.

title: Docstring example in fingerprint.py has incorrect hash value
description: The docstring example in compute_fingerprint() shows a truncated SHA256 hash (40 chars) but the function returns a 64-char hex digest. Example shows 'f1d2d2f924e986ac86fdf7b36c94bcdf32beec15' which is also incorrect - should show the actual hash for {"a": 1, "b": 2}.

title: slug.py keeps stopwords in first 2 positions which may be unintended
description: The slug algorithm keeps tokens in first 2 positions even if they're stopwords (line 99). This means 'The Estate Vineyard' becomes 'the-estate' keeping 'the'. This may be intentional for identity preservation, but should be documented with AIDEV-NOTE explaining the design decision.

title: pyproject.toml entry point references non-existent CLI module
description: pyproject.toml line 46 defines 'itingen = "itingen.cli:main"' but there is no cli.py module in src/itingen/. This will cause ImportError when running 'itingen' command. Need to create cli.py or remove the entry point until Phase 2.6.

title: Extract utils/exif.py with TDD tests
Implement PDF and Markdown Emitters
description: Implement the BaseEmitter interface for PDF and Markdown output formats, moving rendering logic into these role-based components.

title: Placeholder modules should have docstrings explaining intended functionality
description: Empty __init__.py files in config/, ingest/, rendering/, and integrations/ai|maps|weather/ lack docstrings. Per architecture docs, these will contain: config loader, markdown parser, PDF/Markdown emitters, and API integrations. Adding module docstrings would clarify intent.

title: Phase 1: Foundation
description: Meta-issue tracking completion of Phase 1 (Foundation) deliverables. Refactored to align with SPE model.
close_reason: Phase 1: Foundation completed (all utilities extracted and tested)

title: Implement LocalFileProvider (SPE Source)
description: Transition the current ingest and config logic into a unified LocalFileProvider that implements the BaseProvider interface. This will handle Markdown events, YAML configs, and Venue registries.

title: Phase 1.3: Create Extraction Plan
close_reason: Created comprehensive extraction plan with 7 implementation phases

title: Phase 2: Core SPE Abstractions & Domain Models
description: Meta-issue tracking the implementation of the structural foundation of the SPE model, including domain models and base interfaces.

title: Orchestrator execute() silently ignores venues and config from provider
description: In pipeline/orchestrator.py:76-77, get_venues() and get_config() are called but results are not stored or passed to hydrators. The comment says 'for potential future use' but this wastes API calls. Either remove the calls or store results for hydrators to use.

title: exif.py exception handling uses bare except clauses
description: In exif.py lines 77-78 and 128-129, bare 'except Exception' blocks silently return None/False. This masks PIL import errors, permission errors, and disk full errors. Should catch specific exceptions (FileNotFoundError, PermissionError, etc.) and log others.
